alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 11:52PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lincoln, western Forest, Vilas, eastern Oneida and northwestern Langlade Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Winchester to near Rainbow Flowage to near Harrison to 9 miles northeast of Wausau. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rhinelander, Rainbow Flowage and Crystal Lake Scout Reservation around 1155 PM CDT. Eagle River around 1215 AM CDT. Phelps, Kentuck Lake Campground and Headwaters Wilderness around 1230 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gagen, Luna-White Deer Campground, Popple River Headwaters Natural Area, Bastile Lake Natural Area, Kelly Lynn Bog Natural Area, Upper Buckatabon Springs Natural Area, Bavaria, Trout Lake, Koepenick and Doering. Additonal showers and thunderstorms will move across north-central Wisconsin early Thursday morning. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
